question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Supply Validation] miningRewardAmount at line 174 is not validated against NativeTokenTotalSupply - could issuing excessive rewards exceed total supply cap? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Authorization Bypass] The function is private but called from InitialEconomicSystem - if initialization is exploited, could an attacker control miningRewardAmount parameter? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Recipient Validation] If consensusContractAddress at line 168 is null or invalid, does the Issue call at line 171 fail gracefully or cause state corruption? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Negative Value] Is miningRewardAmount validated to be positive, or could passing 0 or negative values break consensus reward distribution? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Symbol Manipulation] Context.Variables.NativeSymbol at line 175 - if this is manipulated, could wrong tokens be issued as mining rewards? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Memo Hardcoding] The memo 'Initial mining reward.' at line 176 is not validated through AssertValidMemo - is this intentional? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Single Issuance] All mining rewards are issued in one transaction - could this create atomicity issues if consensus contract is not ready to receive? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [No Balance Check] Before issuing, is there validation that the Issuer (Context.Self) has authority to mint miningRewardAmount tokens? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Overflow Risk] If miningRewardAmount is close to MAX_LONG, could adding it to existing consensus contract balance cause overflow? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: InitialMiningReward()] [Contract Address Manipulation] GetContractAddressByName at line 168 - could this be manipulated by deploying malicious contracts with reserved names before initialization? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: RegisterElectionVotingEvent()] [State Race Condition] ElectionContract.Value is set at line 182 then immediately used at line 184 - could concurrent transactions cause state inconsistency? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: RegisterElectionVotingEvent()] [Null Contract Address] If GetContractAddressByName returns null at line 183, does the Send call at line 184 fail silently or revert? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: RegisterElectionVotingEvent()] [Missing Return Check] RegisterElectionVotingEvent.Send at line 184 doesn't check return value - could silent failure leave voting events unregistered? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: RegisterElectionVotingEvent()] [Duplicate Registration] If InitialEconomicSystem is called multiple times (before State.Initialized is set), could duplicate event registrations cause issues? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: RegisterElectionVotingEvent()] [Authorization Bypass] This private function is called during initialization - if initialization authorization is bypassed, could an attacker control event registration? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: RegisterElectionVotingEvent()] [Cross-Contract Dependency] If ElectionContract is not properly initialized when this is called, could the Send fail and corrupt initialization? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: RegisterElectionVotingEvent()] [No Validation] The function doesn't validate that State.ElectionContract.Value is non-null after setting - could null pointer exceptions occur? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: SetTreasurySchemeIdsToElectionContract()] [Array Index Out of Bounds] The function accesses schemeIdsManagingByTreasuryContract[0], [3], [4] at lines 203-205 without validating array length - could this cause index out of bounds exceptions? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: SetTreasurySchemeIdsToElectionContract()] [Array Index Out of Bounds] The function accesses schemeIdsManagingByElectionContract[0], [1] at lines 206-207 without validating array length - could empty arrays crash initialization? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: SetTreasurySchemeIdsToElectionContract()] [Scheme ID Manipulation] If Treasury or Election contracts return manipulated SchemeIds, could wrong profit schemes be set, redirecting economic rewards? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: SetTreasurySchemeIdsToElectionContract()] [State Race Condition] ProfitContract.Value is set at line 189 then immediately used at lines 191-200 - could concurrent calls cause inconsistency? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: SetTreasurySchemeIdsToElectionContract()] [Null Address Risk] If GetContractAddressByName returns null at lines 194 or 199, could the GetManagingSchemeIds calls fail? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: SetTreasurySchemeIdsToElectionContract()] [Wrong Scheme Assignment] The hardcoded indices [0], [3], [4] for treasury and [0], [1] for election - are these indices guaranteed by contract initialization order? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: SetTreasurySchemeIdsToElectionContract()] [Missing Validation] TreasuryHash, WelcomeHash, FlexibleHash, SubsidyHash, WelfareHash at lines 203-207 - are these validated to be non-empty hashes? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Function: SetTreasurySchemeIdsToElectionContract()] [Cross-Contract Call Risk] Multiple cross-contract calls to ProfitContract and ElectionContract - if any fail, does initialization rollback completely? (High)
